abstract: The United Nations estimates that 1.6 million to 1.8 million people in developing countries die prematurely each year because of exposure to indoor emissions from inefficient cookstoves. Then there are the black carbon emissions, which hasten global warming.
snippet: The United Nations estimates that 1.6 million to 1.8 million people in developing countries die prematurely each year because of exposure to indoor emissions from inefficient cookstoves. Then there are the black carbon emissions, which hasten global...
lead_paragraph: The United Nations estimates that nearly half the world's population, some three billion people in developing countries, cook over open wood fires or primitive stoves. The practice leads to persistent health problems and accounts for nearly 20 percent of global greenhouse gas emissions.
